Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler

Interface ClientMessageData

  • public interface ClientMessageData
    Operations for writing message content.

    This interface is provided to the handler in ServerDataReplyHandler.handleReadyForData(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ClientMessageData) when the connection is ready to accept message content.

    The handler should:

    1. Write the message content using writeContent() (can be called multiple times)
    2. Call endMessage() to complete the transaction

    The message content should be a valid RFC 5322 formatted message. The connection transparently handles the underlying protocol:

    • If the server supports CHUNKING (BDAT), content is streamed as BDAT chunks with no server roundtrip delay or dot-stuffing overhead
    • Otherwise, traditional DATA mode is used with automatic dot-stuffing

    The handler writes raw message bytes in either case - the protocol differences are handled automatically by the connection.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    ServerDataReplyHandler.handleReadyForData(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ClientMessageData)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void endMessage​(ServerMessageReplyHandler callback)
      Completes the message and submits for delivery.
      void writeContent​(java.nio.ByteBuffer content)
      Writes message content to the server.

    • Method Detail

      • writeContent

        void writeContent​(java.nio.ByteBuffer content)
        Writes message content to the server.

        This method can be called multiple times to stream large messages without buffering the entire content in memory. The connection handles protocol details automatically (dot-stuffing for DATA, BDAT chunks for CHUNKING).

        The content should be part of a valid RFC 5322 formatted message, with CRLF line endings.

        Parameters:
        content - the message content bytes

      • endMessage

        void endMessage​(ServerMessageReplyHandler callback)
        Completes the message and submits for delivery.

        Signals the end of message content and waits for the server's response. On success (250), the handler receives a queue ID and a ClientSession interface for sending more messages.

        Parameters:
        callback - receives the server's response
